title: Implement Digital Operational Resilience Testing Programme
description: As a financial entity, we need to implement a digital operational resilience testing programme as outlined in Article 24, which includes executing various tests such as vulnerability assessments, open source analyses, network security assessments, gap analyses, physical security reviews, questionnaires, scanning software solutions, source code reviews, scenario-based tests, compatibility testing, performance testing, end-to-end testing, and penetration testing, in accordance with the criteria set out in Article 4(2).

title: Conduct Vulnerability Assessments for CSDs and CCPs
description: As a central securities depository (CSD) or central counterparty (CCP), we must perform vulnerability assessments before any deployment or redeployment of new or existing applications, infrastructure components, and ICT services that support critical or important functions of the financial entity.

title: Risk-Based ICT Testing for Microenterprises
description: As a microenterprise, we need to perform ICT testing by combining a risk-based approach with strategic planning, considering the balance between resource scale and time allocation for ICT testing, and the urgency, type of risk, criticality of information assets and services provided, along with other relevant factors such as the entity's ability to take calculated risks.
